comment1.text: Honestly ribs feels like a bad choice for this kind of environment. Are there any other dishes that could work?

comment2.text: This is a common issue with React's useEffect hook. You need to handle the cleanup function properly.

comment3.text: Good luck man! With the food & the inlaws.

comment5.text: I love jam. Just straight jam. My roommate says it's weird but have you ever had a good raspberry jam? It's a kind of edible nirvana.

comment6.text: For the love of good food do NOT get storebought. Just set aside a day to make it yourself, make a good impression.

comment7.text: Maybe before thinking of all that get more cookware... a frying pan if nothing else. Then you can think about grilling.

comment8.text: What do you mean by syrup in 'all quadrants'? It sounds like you're just pouring way too much syrup into each quadrant. Try drizzling it.

comment9.text: If your plan is to be employed at an existing store, they'll probably supply mixers.

comment11.text: Also use excessive herb garnishes. Nothing like a garnish to make a dish look finished.

comment12.text: Not baked pork? Consider a change of profession LOL

comment13.text: Do you have a vested interest in estranging this man from his inlaws?

comment14.text: All you need to prevent that is to open a window...

comment15.text: Good solution, the only issue is that this is the weird possible way to eat waffles.

comment16.text: But what if they get hired tomorrow? Waste of money when they might gain access to an electric mixer soon.

comment17.text: Air fried rice is frankly cursed

comment18.text: A small tip: you can also use fish heads and fins for stock! Waste-not want-not!

comment20.text: This is so true I remember when I was working in a restaurant, half the battle was making the food look like it had just appeared that way. The head chef would be furious if eve a single strand of angel hair was out of place.

comment21.text: I would never personally change my recipe. You already know waht's good.
